Tyler Streeter wrote:

>I just read a paper called "Fitness Uniform Selection
>to Preserve Genetic Diversity" by Marcus Hutter. 
>Here's a link:
>
>www.idsia.ch/~marcus/ai/pfuss.pdf
>
>  
>
[...]

>Does anyone have any thoughts on this selection
>method?
>  
>
You can think of the technique as a form of weak selection, and what we 
currently use as strong selection. We currently apply a strong pressure 
for selecting fit genomes, if you weaken that pressure then you will be 
exploring more of the parameter space around each species before moving 
on. So it's a slower, steadier search. Ultimately though, if you weaken 
the pressure too much then the search will just drift. SharpNEAT has 
parameters that can be adjusted to modify the selection pressure, and 
although not functionally equal to Fitness Uniform Selection I would 
expect the two techniques to have an equivalent effect on searching.

Colin.
